result.execSummary:
The defendant Michelle Janette Wolff was found guilty of the following charge(s) in this case. One or more other charges in this case were dismissed. The dismissed charges were not proven and have no legal effect. Michelle Janette Wolff is presumed innocent of the dismissed charges.

  • Michelle Janette Wolff was found guilty of Forgery-Uttering [Modifiers: Penalties for Felonies-Class "H" Felony], a class H felony, Wisconsin Statutes 943.38(2).

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

parties.name: St Croix County Clerk of Circuit Court
St Croix County Clerk of Circuit Court

supervisions.notes:
Defendant to meet with Probation.
Probation may be transferred to Minnesota.
Court will consider expungement upon 3 years of successful completion of probation.
Court accepts 104 days of ultimate credit and successful completion of AODA.
  
In the event that the defendant is revoked or discharged from either probation or extended supervision with outstanding financial obligations, the supervising agent shall notify the court 10 days prior to the revocation or discharge.  A civil judgment shall be entered against the defendant in favor of restitution victim(s) and/or governmental entities for any balance due.  All available enforcement actions will be used to collect all debt.

-Absolute sobriety:  Zero alcohol, zero controlled substances, zero prescribed medications (except as taken and prescribed for you by a physician) in your system, on your person, or in your possession at all times. This prohibition includes drug paraphernalia.
-NO CONTACT whatsoever with Madison Koepke, Kyle Rinde, Kevin Rinde, Kali Rinde, Isabella Artipe, Kyle VanBlaircom or Adam Fiske.
-Mental Health Evaluation and follow through.

-Pay Supervision fees.
AODA and follow any recommended treatment.

records.addlTxt: Restitution ck#30280, for $1493.90 sent to V.W. this date. cah

Spoke with victim regarding issuing her check for restitution.  Victim was wondering why she was not getting $2,100 since that's what was paid by the DEF in June.  Bookkeeper contacted Dept of Corrections and verified a payment of $996.10 was paid directly to V.W. on 7-25-17, and she also received a check for $150 from St Croix County issued on 6-15-15.  A final restitution check for $1,493.90 will be mailed to DEF. cah

Apprs: CO: SRN, Rpr: Kasten, Clerk: Evenson. ADA: Matthew L Hartung DF ATTY: James H. Krave DF:  Michelle Jeanette Wolff appeared. Case called at 9:08.  Includes 14CF117, 14CM68, 15CF84. Court reviews file and motion to modify the terms of her sentence. DE has completed her AODA treatment in jail. Atty. Krave updates the court and questions the treatment program that was sentenced. ADA Hartung does not object.  Court accepts 104 days of ultimate credit and successful complettion of AODA. 9 months condition time will remain. Court will modify sentence as follows; Court will STAY 6 months condition time to be used by the agent. DE is eligible for release in about 2 weeks.

Apprs: CO: SRN, Rpr: Kasten, Clerk: Evenson. ADA: Matthew L Hartung DF ATTY: James H. Krave DF:  Michelle Janette Wolff appeared from jail. Case called at 10:09. Includes 14CF117, 14CM68, 15CF84. Court reviews files. PSI has been completed. Atty. Krave has no corrections to PSI. ADA Hartung responds. Sentencing arguments. DE mother makes a statement. DE makes statement.  
On 14CF117-  W/H 3 years probation with 9 months condition time.
Conditions:
- Absolute sobriety:  Zero alcohol, zero controlled substances, zero prescribed medications (except as taken and prescribed for you by a physician) in your system, on your person, or in your possession at all times.This prohibition includes drug paraphernalia.
- Restitution of $2825.00
- DE to have absolutely NO CONTACT whatsoever with any of the following named persons and/or locations, Madison Keopke, Kyle Rinde, Kevin Rinde, Kali Rinde, Isabella Artripe, Kyle VanBlaircom and Adam Fiske.  The term "no contact" is hereby defined as no contact in person, by telephone, by way of electronic device, email, facsimile, through the mail, and/or through a third person. 
- AODA and any recommended treatment.
- Mental health evaluation and follow through.  
- DE to submit DNA sample and pay surcharge.
- Costs and costs of supervision. 
- Not to associate with any persons known or suspected to be involved in use, trafficking, dealing or manufacturing of illegal drugs except in a treatment setting.
- Not to enter any business or establishment where the primary purpose is sale of alcohol.
- Maintain employment or resume education. 
- 120 hrs. of community service.
- DE to participate in MRT.  
- Random and regular testing.

On 15CF84 W/H 3 years probation concurrent with 14CF117. 9 months condition time. 
Conditions of probation are to follow 14CF117
- 104 days credit. 
- Costs

On 14CM68 W/H 1 year probation concurrent with 14CF117.
Conditions of probation are to follow 14CF117
- Costs 

If DE completed 3 years of successful completion of probation Court will consider expungement.
Probation to meet with DE. 
Probation can be transferred to MN.

Apprs: CO: SRN, Rpr: Kasten, Clerk: Evenson. ADA: Alexis S. Mckinley DF ATTY: James H. Krave DF: Michelle Janette Wolff appeared from jail. Case called at 3:07. Includes 13CM666, 14CF117, 14CF140, 14CF521, 14CM68, 14CM72 all plea hearings. 15CF84 and 15CF84 arraignment. ADA McKinley makes recommendations. Atty. Krave agrees.   Court reads charge and maximum penalty. DE pleads G to Ct 1 in 15CF84, Ct. 1 in 14CF117, Ct. 1 in 14CM68 DE sworn. Crt reviews plea questionnaire and informs DE of rights. Crt finds DE freely, voluntarily and knowingly waives rights and makes plea. Attorney's stipulate to the facts. Crt accepts plea, finds factual basis and finds DE guilty of 15CF84, Ct. 1 in 14CF117 and Ct. 1 in 14CM68. On motion of the State, Crt dismisses 13CM666, Ct 2-9 in 14CF117, 14CF140, 14CF521,  Ct. 2 in 14CM68, 14CM72 and 15CF88. Sentencing arguments. Court orders a PSI. DE remanded. 
Sentencing hearing scheduled for June 11, 2015 at 10:00 am.

Apprs: CO: SRN, Rpr: Kasten, Clerk: Evenson.ADA:  Alexis S. Mckinley   DF ATTY:  James H. Krave   DF:  Michelle Jeanette Wolff appeared. Includes 13CM666, 14CM68, 14CM72, 14CF117, 14CF140 and 14CF521. Set for a plea however the State is not ready to proceed. The defendant has potential new bail jumping charges. Court allows one more status and will set a trial at that status if not resolved. Address confirmed and bond continues. Defendant to be held if she tests positive.  Status conference scheduled for April 2, 2015 at 01:00 pm.

Apprs: CO: SRN, Rpr: Kasten, Clerk: Evenson. ADA:  Alexis S. Mckinley DF ATTY: James H. Krave DF: Michelle Janette Wolff appeared. Includes 13CM666, 14CM68, 14CM72, 14CF117, 14CF140 all set for a plea hearing and 14CF521 set for prelim. Case called at 9:12.  ADA McKinley filed an Information. ADA McKinley states prelim will be waived and request a plea and sentencing date. Atty. Krave makes agrees. Court advises of rights and possible penalties regarding a preliminary hearing.  Court finds DF has freely, voluntarily, and knowingly waived the right to a preliminary hearing, finds probable cause that a felony was committed and the DF probably committed that felony and binds over for trial.  Plea hearing scheduled for February 11, 2015 at 11:00 am.
Plea hearing on January 6, 2015 at 09:00 am.

**AMENDED**NOVEMBER 26, 2014**INCLUDES 14CF117 AND 14CF140**  

Report every Tuesday and Friday before 5:00pm  to St Croix County Jail for UA testing, in the presence of an officer or deputy of the same sex.  If UA tests positive defendant shall submit to additional evidentiary testing to determine the use of substances forbidden by this bond agreement at the jail or Hudson Hospital.  Defendant must pay $5.00 fee at time of each test.

- Random testing upon reasonable suspicion or at the Court's directive.  DE must pay $5.00 fee at time of each UA test with an officer of the same sex.  

- Absolute sobriety:  Zero alcohol, zero controlled substances, zero prescribed medications (except as taken and prescribed for you by a physician) in your system, on your person, or in your possession at all times while this case is ongoing. This prohibition includes drug paraphernalia.

Court modifies bond for 14CF117 and 14CF140 to have testing on Tuesday's and Friday's with other conditions.  Plea hearing scheduled for January 6, 2015 at 09:00 am.
Plea hearing on November 26, 2014 at 09:00 am.

ADDRESS INFO for Michelle Jeanette Wolff
Current: 3237 90th Drive, Blaine, MN 55449 United States  (Effective: 04-02-2014)
Prior: 1901 Stonepine Bay, Hudson, WI 54016
Appointing Atty Krave. km
Preliminary hearing on April 2, 2014 at 04:30 pm.

It is hereby ordered, as a condition of the defendant's bond/bail in the above-captioned case, that he/she have absolutely NO CONTACT whatsoever with the complaining witness, or with any of the following named persons and/or locations,  Westconsin Credit Union or Check n Go in Hudson.  The term "no contact" is hereby defined as no contact in person, by telephone, by way of electronic device, email, facsimile, through the mail, and/or through a third person.  The aforementioned condition of bond/bail is set pursuant to Sec. 969.02(3)(d), Wis Stats. Defendant not to have a check card or credit card on her person.

Further, it is ORDERED that if the defendant fails to comply with the conditions of his/her bond/bail that he/she may be charged with the offense of bailjumping contrary to Sec. 946.49(1)(a), Wis. Stats.

CO: HWC, RPR: Erin Drost, CLERK: E. Ferrill, ADA:   Michael E. Nieskes,  DF ATTY:  John Kucinski for Atty Krave, DF:  Michelle Jeanette Wolff appeared from jail.    Court informs def of charges, possible penalties and rights. Def understands.  Waives reading. Wiave speedy prelim and time limits.  Preliminary hearing scheduled for April 2, 2014 at 04:30 pm.
